docs.title: Welcome to Bhandara Documentation
docs.text: Bhandara is an Android application built with Kotlin.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
To get started with the project:

  1. Clone the repository
  2. Open in Android Studio
  3. Sync Gradle dependencies
  4. Run the app on an emulator or device

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
bhandara/
├── app/                    # Main application module
│   ├── src/
│   │   └── main/
│   │       ├── java/       # Kotlin source files

│   └── build.gradle.kts    # App-level Gradle config
├── gradle/                 # Gradle wrapper and dependencies
└── build.gradle.kts        # Project-level Gradle config

docs.title: Kotlin Style Guide
docs.text: Follow the official Kotlin coding conventions.

docs.title: File Organization
docs.text:
• One class per file
  • Keep files under 300 lines when possible
  • Group related functionality

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
• Classes: PascalCase (MainActivity, UserViewModel)
  • Functions: camelCase (onCreate(), getUserData())
  • Constants: UPPER_SNAKE_CASE (MAX_COUNT, API_KEY)
  • Variables: camelCase (userName, itemCount)

docs.title: Branch Naming
docs.text:
• feature/feature-name - New features
  • bugfix/bug-description - Bug fixes
  • hotfix/critical-issue - Urgent fixes
  • refactor/component-name - Code refactoring

docs.title: Commit Messages
docs.text:
Follow conventional commits:

feat: add user authentication
fix: resolve crash on startup
docs: update README
refactor: simplify data layer

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Android Studio (latest version)
  • JDK 11 or higher
  • Android SDK
  • Git

docs.title: 1. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/piyushchouhan/bhandara.git
cd bhandara

docs.title: 2. Open in Android Studio
docs.text:
1. Launch Android Studio
  2. Select "Open an Existing Project"
  3. Navigate to the cloned repository
  4. Click "OK"

docs.title: 3. Sync Gradle
docs.text:
Android Studio will automatically sync Gradle. If not:

  1. Click on "File" → "Sync Project with Gradle Files"
  2. Wait for the sync to complete

docs.title: 4. Run the Application
docs.text:
1. Connect an Android device or start an emulator
  2. Click the "Run" button (▶️) in Android Studio
  3. Select your target device
  4. Wait for the app to build and install

docs.title: Google Services
docs.text:
The project uses Firebase. Ensure you have:

  • Valid google-services.json in the app/ directory
  • Firebase project configured properly

docs.title: Local Properties
docs.text:
Check local.properties for SDK paths:

sdk.dir=/path/to/Android/sdk

docs.title: Build Failures
docs.text:
• Clean the project: Build → Clean Project
  • Rebuild: Build → Rebuild Project
  • Invalidate caches: File → Invalidate Caches / Restart

docs.title: Gradle Issues
docs.text:
./gradlew clean
./gradlew build
